content.question: Which of the following best accounts for the pressure in the vessel remaining constant as the volume decreases below <math alttext="0.21 liter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>0.21</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>L</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: The density of the <math alttext="C 4 H 10, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> increases.
The surface area of the interior of the vessel decreases.

The temperature of the <math alttext="C 4 H 10, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> decreases.

Some <math alttext="C 4 H 10, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> condenses to form <math alttext="C 4 H 10, liquid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: Some <math alttext="C 4 H 10, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> condenses to form <math alttext="C 4 H 10, liquid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 4.D: Explain the degree to which a model or representation describes the connection between particulate-level properties and macroscopic properties.
